Package com.example.as1.api

Interface UsersApi

public interface UsersApi
The UsersApi interface defines a set of HTTP RESTful API endpoints for managing user-related operations. It provides methods for retrieving, updating, and deleting user information, as well as handling user authentication, managing favorite recipes, and more. The API endpoints include operations such as: - Getting a list of all users - Retrieving a user by their unique ID - Updating user information - Deleting a user account - User login - Adding and removing favorite recipes for a user - Retrieving a list of a user's favorite recipes - Registering new users - Retrieving a user by their email address This interface is used to generate HTTP requests to the server and receive corresponding responses.
Since:
1.0
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getAllUsers

      @GET("users") retrofit2.Call<List<Users>> getAllUsers()
      Retrieves a list of all users from the API.
      Returns:
      A Call that can be executed to get a list of all users.

    • getUser

      @GET("user/{id}") retrofit2.Call<Users> getUser(@Path("id") Long id)
      Retrieves a user by their unique ID from the API.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique ID of the user to retrieve.
      Returns:
      A Call that can be executed to get a user by ID.

    • updateUser

      @PUT("users/put/{id}") retrofit2.Call<Users> updateUser(@Path("id") Long id, @Body Users newInfo)
      Updates user information using their unique ID and new user information.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique ID of the user to update.
      newInfo - The new user information to replace the existing data.
      Returns:
      A Call that can be executed to update user information.

    • deleteUser

      @DELETE("users/delete/{id}") retrofit2.Call<Void> deleteUser(@Path("id") Long id)
      Deletes a user account using their unique ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique ID of the user to delete.
      Returns:
      A Call that can be executed to delete a user account.

    • login

      @POST("users/login") retrofit2.Call<String> login(@Body LoginRequest loginRequest)
      Performs user authentication by sending a login request with user credentials.
      Parameters:
      loginRequest - The login request containing user email and password.
      Returns:
      A Call that can be executed to perform user login.

    • addFavoriteRecipe

      @POST("users/{userId}/addFavRecipe/{recipeId}") retrofit2.Call<Void> addFavoriteRecipe(@Path("userId") Long userId, @Path("recipeId") Long recipeId)
      Adds a recipe to a user's list of favorite recipes using user and recipe IDs.
      Parameters:
      userId - The user's unique ID.
      recipeId - The recipe's unique ID to add as a favorite.
      Returns:
      A Call that can be executed to add a favorite recipe.

    • deleteFavoriteRecipe

      @DELETE("users/{userId}/removeFavRecipe/{recipeId}") retrofit2.Call<String> deleteFavoriteRecipe(@Path("userId") Long userId, @Path("recipeId") Long recipeId)
      Removes a recipe from a user's list of favorite recipes using user and recipe IDs.
      Parameters:
      userId - The user's unique ID.
      recipeId - The recipe's unique ID to remove from favorites.
      Returns:
      A Call that can be executed to remove a favorite recipe.

    • getFavoriteRecipes

      @GET("users/{userId}/favRecipe") retrofit2.Call<List<Recipe>> getFavoriteRecipes(@Path("userId") Long userId)
      Retrieves a list of favorite recipes for a specific user using their unique ID.
      Parameters:
      userId - The user's unique ID.
      Returns:
      A Call that can be executed to get a list of favorite recipes for the user.

    • RegisterUsers

      @POST("users/register") retrofit2.Call<String> RegisterUsers(@Body Users newUser)
      Registers a new user by sending user registration information as a request body.
      Parameters:
      newUser - The new user information to register.
      Returns:
      A Call that can be executed to register a new user.

    • GetUsersByEmail

      @GET("users/getEmail/{email}") retrofit2.Call<Users> GetUsersByEmail(@Path("email") String email)
      Retrieves a user by their email address from the API.
      Parameters:
      email - The email address of the user to retrieve.
      Returns:
      A Call that can be executed to get a user by email.
